title: Shopgirl
content:
I thought I read in a review of the new Steve Martin fiilm (and book) Shopgirl that one of the main characters was a font designer. I googled and found out it was not a typo.

[http://www.microsoft.com/typography/links/news.aspx?NID=5142](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504031539/http:/www.microsoft.com/typography/links/news.aspx?NID=5142 "http://www.microsoft.com/typography/links/news.aspx?NID=5142")

Wondering if there are any other movie characters who are font designers? Once in a while you catch someone who is a graphic designer or illustrator But even that is pretty rare.

Anyone care to share their cinematic knowledge or is this the only example?

 [‹ 1850s Australia type examples](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504031539/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15421 "Go to previous forum topic") [Why not Tahoma? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504031539/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15677 "Go to next forum topic")
author: roballoo

comments.content: I seem to recall that the character Noel (Scott Foley) in the tv show “Felicity” designed a font at one point. He was also designing web pages, Flash animations, etc. I think it was a “grunge” font.
There’s a short thread on Domino and Shopgirl here - [http://typophile.com/node/15660](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504031539/http:/typophile.com/node/15660 "http://typophile.com/node/15660")
